Reviews.Title: “Will come back here again!”
Reviews.Author: Dhei S
Reviews.Content: Service was nice, the lady that helped us even called our room to make sure that everything was okay! Breakfast was yummie with waffles and some muffins!:) I really enjoyed our stay here because everything was clean and the staff were really nice. I had a good sleep too, their king bed was awesome! The only thing that made me sad was that the pool was not heated so it was hard to swim around 10am. Overall, I will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay in the suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Petra_DL
Reviews.Content: We preferred this area above the busy downtown of LA, and it worked out very good. Hollywood is only a 20-30 minute drive away. This hotel was reasonably priced and if we had to stay in this area again, we would probably come back. The staff was friendly, our room was quiet, even though it was near the noisy road. Our room was pretty basic but clean, except that I smelled some smoke sometimes. Comfortable bed. The only negative points I have to make was that the extra lock of the door was broken and the indoor fridge was very noisy. The breakfast is complementary, but itÂ´s also very basic and the breakfast area is pretty small, but you can take it out to your room. The hotel has a nice outdoor pool area. There are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Some of the rooms seem to have a balcony, ours didnÂ´t. All in all: good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A small town hotel”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: My latest trip took me to Los Amgeles where I stayed in the Best Western Woodland Hills as part of a special event package for the wedding of a friend. Ended up staying for a little less than a week, I have been able to accumulate the following review: 1-Location The hotel is located 30 min away from Los Angeles in a nice suburb called Woodland Hills. It is not an exciting place to be in as it does not offer good entertainment as you would expect from being closer to the city. You definitely need a car to commute back and forth to the exciting location around town. On the other hand, it is situated in the middles of a commercial area where a lot of bars, fast food outlets, and a Westfield shopping mall are just in close proximity. The only close entertainment attraction is Universal Studios which is approximately 20 min away by car. 2- The hotel It looks a lot like a motel complex rather than a hotel. It is composed of a circle shaped like building with rooms distributed on two stories. The ground level is too close to the parking area and you wills ably get awaken by the car noises or shouts of gets getting in Late. The upper level is not much better off as oh will keep on getting hit by the noise of cars and guests. The hotel does not scre high on its appearance, you will definitely not find sofitel's glamour or Westin's magic. If you are looking for luxury, that pace is definitely not where you want to stay. 3-Rooms This is probably the best scoring part of the complex. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, a very large bed is situated in the middle with a big TV screen just centered around your sleeping area. Rooms come with a sofa at the entrance next to the door and Re equipped with the accessories you would find in most hotels, from a coffee machine to a fridge... While the equipment might be a little old with signs of usage, the TV is not even plasma and there are no DVD decks attached or iPod docking station. The AC and heating system is situated just under the window, it is very effective at cooling the room or heating it up, but it is very noisy and you might want to turn it off before you sleep to avoid getting awaken by a loud flow of air getting on every 10 min 4- Services There are not much services offered in the hotel. But at least the net is free. Distributed over wi-fi, it remains at very high speed and accessible all day long. I find this as a big plus as still lots of 5 star hote S still charge you for the net. Breakfast is also available for free with the room, but served I. The breakfast area next to the rectilinear. That area only has one table and will definitely fit 4 or 5 guests, so don't expect to be sitting on a table enjoying coffee. It is intended to just grab what you want and be on your way. It is also worth noting that you need to step out in the open and walk to the reception, not much of a thing during winter. 5- Personel They are surely worthy of a 5 star hotel. I love smily helpful hosts. I was greeted with a big smie by really lovely front dek officers who were more than kind in explaining everything about the hotel and the area. They did not hesitate in offering me all the assistance I needed, they even called after my check in to see if everything is fine. Room service Personel are also very kind and really friendly. All in all I rate this place a s a 3, it is very average and definitely a place you will stay in if you are on a budget or because you have an occasion in the surrounding area. If you intend to see more of Los Angeles without commuting and enduring the endless freeway traffic of LA, you definitely need to stay close to Hollywood

Reviews.Title: “We stay here when flying from LAX”
Reviews.Author: cmdevenney
Reviews.Content: We like to stay here when we are flying from LAX, this hotel is about 30-40 min from the airport depending on traffic. it is conveniently located near the 101 freeway. There are several cute resturants near by, within walking distance. The place is clean affordable and has cool suites w/ a whirlpool tub in the room. We like to return to this Best Western time and again. Geart guest service, I just mentioneda small problem w/ the room uponcheck out and they took 10% off for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in LA with a car”
Reviews.Author: ragdias
Reviews.Content: I stayed around 10 days in this hotel while exploring Los Angeles. Whilst it's not the obvious choice for leisure it was a good option to explore the multiple options in Los Angeles. Even though you probably know that in Los Angeles you MUST rent a car to enjoy the city properly, this hotel is not on walking distance to any attraction so i strongly advise to come with a car. One annoying thing about the hotel was the noise from the cars and noise from the doors shutting. It was clean, the breakfast in the morning was satisfactory (even though could run later hours on weekends), price was fair and room has a good size.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Money”
Reviews.Author: orimarc
Reviews.Content: As you know, LA is huge and some places should be avoided. We did not have any problem during our stay in this Best Western. Our room was 237, facing the tiny pool. Room was quiet. Staff was helpful. The nreakfast was a joke. They give it to you in a very small room. It seems they do not want you to have it!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 2010 (a year ago) and still remember the bad experience. The room wasn't ready when we got there. Trash was on the floor. Maintenance guy thought we should stay in the room anyway. We were put in a suite and we understood it was ours for both scheduled nights. Next day the manager said we had to move to another, regular room, so sorry for the inconvenience. No help moving our bags. Friend came to visit and swore she saw a rat running down the hallway. There was no A/C in the bedroom in the suite and it remained hot in that room while we were there. Front desk staff not very interested in our unhappiness. Will never stay there again. Have stayed in many, many BW hotels-this was our only bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort for the Money”
Reviews.Author: italianfoodie
Reviews.Content: We have to travel to the area twice a month so we stay two, maybe three days a month at this hotel. The staff is gracious, accomodating and helpful. They have given us almost the same room as requested each stay.The beds not as lumpy as some, but my husband who is a chiropractor likes it. I am more particular. I gave it a 3 star only because the air conditioner is one of those huge blowing fan types and its very annoying. You have to be really really tired to overcome it. The bathroom is tiny so much so that you cannot sit on the toilet with the door open and as it is, the toilet seat is not home and uncomfortable. But have to say the room smells okay, everything clean esp the tub/shower. I do like the shower spray and we get hot water nicely. No toiletries to speak of, the kleenex sandpaper and towels threadbare. There is a complimentary breakfast nook in the lobby but we never indulge in the 7-11 kind of wrapped up food to heat. This particular hotel is jam packed all the time. We reserve months ahead. On the busiest street in Woodland Hills- Ventura Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighbourhood, noisy room.”
Reviews.Author: Hansel2000
Reviews.Content: We had a view to a wall directly from our window. There was a noisy AC outside the window and outside the door so we had to use earplugs every night. We expected to get a balcony, but found out during check-in that only about 1/3 of the rooms have a balcony

Reviews.Title: “Updated Best Western, not so great area.”
Reviews.Author: musicaltour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with friends. The front desk staff were nice. Our room was nice and clean. We had a bottle opener on the wall...that's interesting. Only negative was parking but this is LA area we are talking about. We had to park next door at the restaurant and I was not too thrilled about parking away from the hotel. Breakfast was nothing special, but there are plenty of places to get food across the street and the freeway is just down the road. If you want a location close to attractions without a high price tag, this would be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced, motel style hotel in the LA valley.”
Reviews.Author: Travlalu
Reviews.Content: You know you've arrived in LA when you see the towering stucco buildings the palm lined streets and are in close proximity to ribbons of criss crossing freeways.This Best Western hotel is in the heart of the valley on the famous Ventura Blvd-so wide you might need 10 minutes to cross it. Seriously though , we chose this hotel specifically because it had free parking and was in a relatively quieter part of LA but easily connected to arterial roads and the freeway system.It's hard to get around LA without a car and we rented one to get us moving.Most of the sites you'll want to see in LA-Santa Monica beach,Rodeo Drive Beverly Hills,Universal Studios,Disneyland (which is in Orange county)-you'll definitely need a car to get to.LA is colossal.This hotel helps with ample parking and an easy drive to the 101 freeway. The style of the hotel is definitely motel style with your car parked right up close by the room and a walk way/balcony running the length of the rooms.The rooms are clean and there's a coin op laundry down below for guests use, which we found pretty handy.The front desk staff are chirpy and helpful and there is a free breakfast next to the lobby.Beware though that the breakfast room is ultra small and you'll find yourself competing for space at the rush hour.They serve cereals,supermarket style pastries,boiled eggs,toast,coffee/tea and DIY waffles-nothing gastronomically spectacular.However compensating for the lack of space, there's no problem taking food back to your room so you can utilize the extra space there.If you'd prefer a different food scene there's some healthier options with Jamba Juice and a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf outlet across the road. The hotel is within walking distance of many supermarkets,restaurants, and other food outlets,a pharmacy and even a newsstand,so you are not without resources.As for proximity to tourist attractions you will definitely be in need of a vehicle.This hotel is very practical and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt bad at all! Just a few tweaks would have been nice.”
Reviews.Author: PediDr
Reviews.Content: Had decided on this hotel due to location and previous reviews. I agree with previous raters that the hotel was MUCH quieter than I expected to be. When we arrived, they had upgraded us to a room with a patio area, right off the pool and spa- we were concerned it would be noisy from the pool/spa but it wasnt at all and you also couldnt hear any road noise from the busy road in front of the hotel. Gave a good nights sleep from the sound perspective. Bedding and towels were clean so no concern there. The hair dryer didnt work; we forgot to mention until we checked out; but the front desk employee apologized twice about it during our check out. had a clean fridge and mini microwave in the room. When we turned the air on in the room, it gave off a moldy smell that was pretty icky but fortunately we had a visit during an unusually cool June and could leave the sliding back door open without any problem. They were great about extra towels when we needed them and I saw several times during the visit a maintenance person on the grounds actively working on keeping things up to standard. (including applying touch up paint to a chair, repainting a door, pruning landscape) so its obvious they were working to keep the place up kept. Breakfast was basic- waffles, hard boiled eggs, coffee, muffin/danish prepackaged, cheerios/raisin bran/rice krispies, apples. Basic but we went by the whole foods a block away (also a farmers market across the street) and bought some fresh berries to go on the waffles (yum!). With the price after taxes (in Cali- ouch!) for 110/night, it was better than some in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TroutKing
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a business trip to Los Angeles. The front desk was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, quiet and spacious, there was free in-room wifi and a PC in the lobby (including a printer, e.g. for printing out boarding cards for LAX), and the area boasts a wide range of decent restaurants and shopping opportunities. The 101 freeway is right nearby, making this an ideal hotel for business trips or generally for exploring the Los Angeles area. When I had a small problem with my in-room television and called the front desk, it was instantly clear that they were taking my request very seriously and went to great effort to solve my problem as quickly as possible. The only potential downside: the mattresses are very hard; while I personally love a good hard mattress, others who prefer softer beds might wake up a tad stiff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay for the right traveler”
Reviews.Author: Mangonboat
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is squeezed in along Ventura Blvd in Woodland Hills. Parking, hi-speed wireless and breakfast are free, the rooms are clean and he staff could not be more friendly and sincere. Many restaurants in easy walking distance. You can spend $100 more / night for the Hilton 2 blocks away, but for business traveler, this was everything I needed. The rooms have exterior doors and parking is close to the street, but it was not noisy the night I stayed. If you dont need frills, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollie2007
Reviews.Content: On checking in,we were met by very friendly and helpful staff. Room was large,very clean and we also had a lovely terrace with seating. The pool area was quiet and well looked after.. perfect to relax after a day seeing the sights of Los Angeles. Internet access was available in hotel reception.Staff were great at giving directions to see the sights of LA and also recommending place to eat. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler93277
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Best Western many times for business. Great location...easy access to the 101 freeway, eateries across the street, Westfield Mall nearby, beautiful scenic drive through Topanga Canyon to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “One of the quietest hotel I've been in”
Reviews.Author: pamsterz
Reviews.Content: Not a glamorous hotel, but was very comfortable, very clean, and very quiet. There are plenty of convenience items located within walking distance {Jerry's Deli (which includes a bar), Western Bagel, Ralph's grocery store, RiteAid, Starbucks, a news stand, etc.} Having a mini fridge and a microwave was a plus. They are slightly low on the amenities, so bring your own travel toilettries. Front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Free USA Today in lobby every morning was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Davepuddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in November while attending a family wedding. I had stayed a few nights just before at the Holiday Inn a few minutes down the road which was very noisy due to being right beside the 101 freeway. The Best Western was very quiet and the room was spotless. The check-in was very smooth and friendly staff. The only minor fault was the worn down carpet in the room. There was also a complimentary breakfast which I never took advantage of but great value never the less! I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a quiet stay at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “VERY, VERY QUIET”
Reviews.Author: sunnyWashingtonstate
Reviews.Content: I had wanted a hotel closer to Burbank but was unable to find an affordable one. Chose this hotel due to other positive reviews and I was not disappointed. This hotel had great service, easy to find but it was so quiet. I never heard anything-traffic or people yet the hotel was full each night I was there. Rooms was very comfortable and had no problem with room being stocked each day with needed items. Even though this was farther from Burbank, I traveled side streets like Ventura and Burbank Avenues if highway was packed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: gonebutnotdeparted
Reviews.Content: This place was great and had everything I needed. Couple of minor issues: It was 105 in the valley that day so when I checked in, the room was very hot and it took forever for the litttle window unit to make it comfortable. That is probably not typical though. If the staff is reading this: lay off the room deoderizer or whatever it is that you are using. I found it overwelming. Maybe because you allow pets. Might be better if you offered pet-free rooms although maybe you do -I did not check when I called. Years ago, before priceline, I used to stay at Best Westerns and always found them adequate for my needs; quiet, comfortable and consistant at a fair price. Decided to try them again because although I usually price line 4 stars at an even lower price; no 4 stars available in this area and 3 star pricelines can be problematic. Also I had just stayed at a Doubletree the week before for $416 incl taxes for two nights (not priceline!) and had lots of problems, and so question the whole "price gets you something" theory. Why did I ever stop going to BW?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: spinoc
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 11 pm with no reservation and just needed a decent place to stay as a solo female for one night. The front desk clerk was very nice and helpful and got me a great room not far from the entrance for an excellent price. The room was larger and nicer than I expected - there was a king-size bed, a small loveseat, granite counter on the vanity and the TV got HBO and a lot of other stations. It was very quiet - I always carry earplugs when I travel and didn't need them at all here. There is a Jerry's Famous Deli across the street and other options for eating within easy distance. The BW offered a free breakfast but I was so tired I didn't leave the room until checkout time at 11 a.m. and breakfast is only there until 9 a.m. so I can't comment on it. I would stay there again if I needed a place in the San Fernando Valley area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TN_Hiker
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. We have enjoyed both our stays. Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Check in/out was a breeze. The breakfast area is small, but they donâ€™t seem to mind if you take items back to your room. We were always there early and did not have any problem finding a seat. They offered the usual breakfast fare, cereal, juice, muffins, pastries, etc. The pool area seemed clean, I didnâ€™t try the hot tub. I donâ€™t understand the comments about this being a bad area (especially from the reviewer that hails from Memphis of all places). I wouldnâ€™t think of visiting any area Iâ€™m not familiar with and walking around at night, but during the day we had no problems. We walked across the street to the drugstore and even picked up a few groceries next door and ate at the deli and never felt the least bit unsafe. This location is convenient to shopping and the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for a family”
Reviews.Author: SPB901
Reviews.Content: When I planned my trip to Los Angeles, I figured that this is a good place to stay location wise because it is in the middle of everything. When I got to the hotel, I realized it was not in a good area. I checked in at about midnight and the guy at the desk would not let us in; he was behind bullet proof class. Also, there are outside corridors and it's not good in an area like this. Also, the breakfast was lousy. There wasn't place to sit and the food variety was very small. After one day, I checked out and went to a hotel in Pasadena. It was much nicer and safer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nicely upgraded”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago and wasnt particularly impressed but they have done some remodeling since. The rooms are remodeled and cleaner than they were then. The location can seem somewhat sketchy but I wasnt worried about running 7 miles around the area. There is food near the two malls down Topanga Canyon road. I got a great room for about $120/night with a nice patio and comfy bed. Very happy with what they have done. The options in the area are definitely less desirable.

Reviews.Title: “I'll just cross this one off of my list...”
Reviews.Author: sloopiek
Reviews.Content: Formerly Aku Aku motel, this property is now a Best Western after undergoing an extensive facelift. The old polynesian tiki facade is gone and replaced by a more modern, semi-mediterranean style front. The rooms have also been overhauled, with the addition of crown moulding and new carpeting, fresh paint, etc. Unfortunately, the seamy underbelly of the Aku Aku still shows. We stayed here two nights in early October, displaced from downtown Los Angeles by the convergence of two major college football games and a baseball playoff game all on the same weekend. This was as close as we could get and still keep the nightly tab under $110 without getting head lice. First few signs were bad omens; the magnetic keys did not work, so I headed back to the lobby to have them re-programmed. Second try was a little better, but still only one of the keys worked. When we entered the room, it looked alright. The pictures on the website looked much better, though. Sure, they had spent some money on crown moulding, paint, and carpeting. It was obvious that the money spent on those features came out of the bedding and linens budget. The sheets seemed thin and threadbare, the towels were of a motel 6 quality, kind of coarse and thin. Little things, like table lamps not quite matching their "motif", and having internet, but not wireless internet. They seemed to have run out of money before they could get this place to a 3-star level. Then, around 2pm, the locals starting congregating outside the liquor store directly across the street. Pretty soon the car stereo with the stadium sound bass woofers was shaking down the motel room. A call to the desk brought no results, as the problem was "off the property". After about 45 minutes the concert ended and the crowd dispersed. The ballyhooed breakfast bar was a bust. Two bins of cereal, doughy cheap bagels and muffins, one waffle machine with a line 5 people long waiting to use it, etc. We headed across the street and bought some decent pastry and coffee at Coffee Bean and Tea. The final insult was upon leaving; our 16 year old daughter left her orthodonture retainer on the table between the beds. As soon as we got home that night we realized it had been left at the motel, and called the night clerk. The maid would be in the next morning and they would check and call us back. No call. We called again, and were summarily told that the retainer was "not found" (i.e. thrown out). Oh well. Should have spent the extra money and stayed in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang For Your Buck!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadians33
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful experience began at check-in with the friendly and helpful staff. The newly renovated hotel reminded us of a mexican retreat. The two story building bodded large spacious rooms with a very comfortable bed. Rooms were extremely clean and the cleaning staff were accommodating to our needs of additional towels and linen. Besides the wonderful rooms, the outdoor pool and hot tub was an oasis within themselves. The other added benefit to this hotel is its proximity to the highway and special attractions. Be sure to bring a GPS so that you can avoid traffic jams by putting in alternative routes which seem to be just as quick. Besides the free parking on site, our daily included breakfast was one we looked forward to everyday. The variety of options from homemade waffles to cereal and bagels, were a great boost to start the day. Jerry's Deli accross the street was a great restaurant offering a variety of food and huge portions. Ralph's Grocery Store is also across the street for alcohol and their must have delicious bagels. We highly recommend this hotel for everyone's needs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the Valley!”
Reviews.Author: kobeezgirl8
Reviews.Content: My Fiance's company has an office right in Warner Center and they transferred him down (from northern cali) to temporarily work for the Woodland Hills Office (stays in LA range from 3-5 days/week) After much searching (there aren't many options in WH) and price checking (how the hilton can charge so much is beyond me...) We decided he would stay at the Best Western (decision made for location and that there is a fridge and microwave in every room-his company is picking up the tab for the stay..but even if we were paying for it ourselves i would say its better than the overpriced hotels in warner center) I visited him this past weeekend so i am writing the review on his behalf. The rooms are CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. the halls are clean clean clean, the lobby is clean clean clean (and cozy for that matter.) it felt like i could take my shoes off and walk around (even though i would NEVER, haha) the layout is nice. you park in front of your room. the bottom level is at street level-doors rigth off the parking lot, the upstairs rooms are along inside hallways. The bathroom sink is out in the room, standard shower/tub and toilet with a door, even a full length mirror in the bathroom, score! free wireless- just ask the lobby for an ethernet cable. location: perfect right on ventura blvd. across the street are some excellent staples: Jerry's Famous Deli- a bit overpriced, but good eats, noahs bagels, jamba, coffee bean/tea leaf,western bagel, ralphs grocery store, rite-aid, starbucks subway, chipotle, blockbuster, gnc..and his personal favorite- California Pita for the FRO-YO!!! whoever said they felt "unsafe" or it was "ghetto" has never spent a minute in San Fernando Valley. born and raised there i can definitely assure you that, while there may be a few homeless hanging around...its your typical valley neighborhood. bottom line- for a business traveler, someone visiting family in the area or a quick get-away (they do have a pool..and the Topanga Plaza is outta this world for shopping...right around the corner-too far to walk though) it is SPOT ON...for $109/night...cheap! its def worth the visit. adn its so cute too!

Reviews.Title: “An Actually Positive Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MizKitty007
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to battle the morning drive from Orange County to a prospective client meeting at Warner Center (the latter right up the street from this Best Western), I made a reservation at the Woodland Hills Inn for the night before. The room's cleanliness and amenities were just as I expected: wonderful, once I got past the room's stuffiness (from the combination of the second floor and the heat that rose during the day) and turned on the air conditioning. If more than waffles, juice, cereal, and coffee are wanted at breakfast, go to one of the neighborhood restaurants on Ventura orâ€”as I didâ€”to the Whole Foods just four blocks east (at the northeastern corner of Canoga and Ventura). P.S. While I express my apologies to the reviewer before me for what she experienced, I'd also be remiss as a veteran traveler if I didn't point out that some of it was preventable. The first line of defense is to look over paperwork CAREFULLY before signing/initialing it at check-in. I've caught wrong in and out dates, wrong rates, or both on a few occasions over the yearsâ€”and have rectified it on the spot. Then check it again first thing in the morning and resolve if needed. The second line is that if any nonfood, nonmeltable items of nominal or higher value were purchased expressly for the vacation, leave it locked up in the cool part of the car. Retrieve then only when needed. The third line is that if leaving the room for a few hours in the morning with an expected return around the time guests are checking out, make sure that "Do Not Disturb" or "Privacy, Please" sign is hanging or (in the case of this particular property) inserted into the keycard reader before departing for that short period. Even the least English-literate among the housekeeping staff can read those!

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: WanaBinHawaii
Reviews.Content: This property left a lot to be desired. I had arranged for a suite with 2 queen beds anticipating it would be similar to a place we had stayed in Anaheim - 2 separate rooms with a bed in each room and a separate sitting area with kitchen amenities. I was wrong . . . it is one typical hotel room with two queen beds next to each other and a half room with a small hide-a-bed, tv, and wet bar. When we arrived, we were told the people who had occupied the room the night before had extended their stay another night, so we were offered one room with two queen beds or two rooms and hotel staff would move us the following day. We chose the one room. The beds were like rocks! I've never slept on such hard mattresses!! The next day the hotel staff moved our belongings into the suite while we were out, but didn't move my daughter's pillow. When we realized it wasn't there, the person at the front desk wasn't able to help us because he said he was the only person on duty and that he would have to contact the housekeeping staff who had all gone home at this point. We also needed a toothbrush which they advertised as being a complementary service if you forgot yours, but we were told they were all out. We also had problems with the internet cable - it worked in one room, but not the other. Again, the person at the front desk wasn't able to help us. Fortunately, there was a shift change and the next front desk person was able to explain that the internet cable only worked in one room and they retrieved the missing pillow. We went out and bought our own toothbrush. The location of the hotel is right on Ventura Blvd. - a VERY BUSY street - and you are only allowed to make a right turn when leaving the hotel. This is definitely a disadvantage if you need to go the opposite direction. There is a side gate to the parking lot, which would allow you access to points west, but it is locked shut. The property should install something in the ground which would open it when a car approached from the inside for the convenience of its guests! A couple more comments - the mattresses in the suite were a little softer, but by the end of our stay, my body ached from sleeping in the bed. The mattress on the hide-a-bed was very thin and when my daughter laid on it, she felt the bar right through it. She ended up sleeping on it as a couch. AND the water temp in the shower was either hot or scalding! There was no cold water! I must say the price of the room and the fact they offered a suite with 2 queen beds was the reason I chose this property. It wasn't worth it. I wouldn't stay here again. Sorry Best Western. I've had better.

Reviews.Title: “Made me warm and fuzzy”
Reviews.Author: NewYork08
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for almost a week-great place and can not beat the price plus location Rooms are nice and clean, continental breakfast served, TV , Internet connection, very clean bathroom they have pool and hot tub - great! hotel looks like Spanish house - very warm feeling clerks are friendly they even have laundry-shall you run out of clean clothes 15 miles away from Malibu Great place! Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Failure to Communicate”
Reviews.Author: WLParker
Reviews.Content: Motel-ish but clean on Ventura Blvd in Woodland Hills, CA. Just wanted rest and a few hours sleep before returning home to San Diego after a big family get together. Snuggle, late night TV, then blitz, NO TV signal, called front desk, a "Communication problem", offered my snoring husband in return! Vacated premises early AM, still a failure to communicate with TV. Advise- Spend an extra $20.00 per night to get what you should have, it's worth it! W.Parker

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: ebalmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3/11-3/15 for a family funeral, as did several other family members. The hotel was very clean, looked recently renovated, had everything we could have needed and was more than adequate. I am totally astonished that anyone could suggest that the area is "scary". It's a typical Valley street with a shopping center directly across the street with Jerry's Deli (great), Coffee Bean and Jamba Juice. The proximity to everything was great. The only drawback was the small parking lot-we always managed to get a spot, but it was tight. I would definitely stay here again-hopefully for a happier occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: allsportsfanG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because we were working nearby.I normally like to stay at 4 or 5 star hotels but this was for work.It looked like it has just been remodeled and they did a great job.Its a very clean hotel and its pretty cheap.We paid $114 a night.If you have to stay in woodland hills this is a pretty good place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: ndcoomes
Reviews.Content: I stayed her many times when it was the Aku AKu and always found it ok. The remodel and switch to Best Western has made it much better. The rooms are nicely done, not fancy but clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and the pool was clean and warm, and mostly empty which was nice. There are indeed some nice places to eat within easy walking distance. If you like sushi, Somethings Fishy is excellent and right next door to the hotel. As far as this being a bad area, that is non sense. This is one of the safer areas in the valley, of course use common sense at all times in all areas. As far as the Best Western its lots of bang for the buck and I will for sure stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: astro50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place one night because I got to Los Angeles after a trip on coastal California one day prior to what I had planned and all the other places were fully booked. Only reading tripadvisor I realized it belonged to the Best Western chain! This is a motel like the ones I am used to see at the movies, scary like some other reviewer called it. It has no confort at all, you are charged for the rooom at check in and I found out later they charged my credit card $10 for calls I never made. I was asked at check in if I intended to do any calls and I answered that I didn't know if I needed to call my friend who lived in LA. I did no calls but I was charged anyway and 10 bucks! The rooms are awful, dated, worn, stains on the carpet ,with the bathroom sink inside the room. I felt very insecure and unsafe in the room ,which was on the back of the building and had to climb some stairs to take my luggage. The reception is a balcony and nothing else. They don't serve any breakfast. I also didn't like its location. Horrible neighbourwood! I just saw the pictures in Expedia. Are we talking about the same place? The reception and rooms have nothing to do with the pictures they put on Expedia, please, don't go for it!!!! An experience to be forgotten! Would never again stay in such an awful place!

Reviews.Title: “New rooms were great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked one of their newer rooms. They called them the "Preferred" rooms. They did a great job on their remodel. Simple, but nice. The microwave came in handy for a late night popcorn snack where we kicked up our feet on the sofa and coffee table. There was some traffic noise on the nearby boulevard, but not enough to stop our sleep. They also have alot of cool restaurants nearby. For the price, the new rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst and ... the Best (at least for the price!)”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud92
Reviews.Content: Coming from France, we had been there in 1996 and had good memories of the rooms and the small pool (conveniently out of Ventura Bd). So we went back in 2005 and boom, it was "Back to the Past". Same carpeting, same A/C and a dilapidated feeling about the whole experience. So we just stayed 2 nights and decided to switch to the nearby Comfort Inn East on Ventura Bd. If Aku Aku was bad, the Comfort Inn was worst. So out of idea we went back to the Aku Aku and oh surprise they proposed us their brand new rooms for a small increase of price. And really, for 80 USD you can't complain : new furnitures, new A/C, large clean rooms, everything fine. Definitely not palace but a real good deal for L.A. Next thing to do : renovate the pool and change the deckchairs !
